Key:
(I bought all the things I needed, so all that's
left is...)
(The tea set Kotori asked me to buy.)

Listen to me, Shido. Your adorable little sister
is going to use this tea set. If you screw this
up, I will rip it off and use it as a saucer.

(...That's what she told me. I don't know what
she's going to rip off, but I can't mess this up.)

(I wonder if there are any good stores around...
Wait a minute... that's...)

(An antique store... I didn't know that
was there.)
(...Iyotokado, huh? What an odd name.)

(But the shop window seems to have some dinnerware
on display. Maybe I'll find some tea sets inside.)

(The shop seems high-end, so I'm kind of
intimidated... All right, here goes nothing.)
Excuse me...
(This shop is really something.)

(It's bigger than I expected. There are tons of
things here...)

(At the center of the store was a doll. Really
pretty, and life-sized. Wow, I wonder how
much it is...)
Welcome. Can I help you with anything?
Whoa.
Hm? Is something the matter?

Oh... sorry. Are you the staff here? You were so
beautiful that I thought you were a doll.

My, you're very kind. I'm the owner of this shop.
My name is Tohka.
O-Oh, so you're the owner. I'm sorry...
Tohka, that sounds familiar...
Oh, that's right. "Iyo Tohka do."

Yes. I'm embarrassed to admit that my name is in
the shop's name.

I see. No wonder why it sounded so familiar. Makes
sense.
But then, what does the "Iyo" part mean?
My grandfather passed away a few years ago.
Huh? O-Oh okay... I see... So it's his name, huh?

My grandfather started this place, and named it a
combination of his and my name, but I am currently
the sole owner.

I-I see. I'm sorry for asking such a sensitive
question... I wish I could have met Iyo-san.
It's actually pronounced "Iyo."
Oh, I'm sorry!

It's fine. I may not be worthy, but I would love
to show you around.

What? Don't say that. You're handling this place
on your own, right? Despite looking like you're
my age.
No, I'm not good at all yet...

Honestly, I've never met anyone as elegant as you.
It's hard to explain, but you seem to embody the
spirit of the shop. I think that's amazing.
Oh, um... You're making me blush.
Is something the matter?
No, it's... Tohka-san, you're so gorgeous.
...Thank you.
So what kind of item are you looking for today?

Oh, uh, yeah. I'm looking for an item for my
little sister....

If she's your little sister, she must be quite
adorable. I am certain that I can find an
appropriate item for you.
(Oh wow, she returned the compliment...)

Besides, this store has a variety of items. I'm
sure I can provide something in your budget.
Th-Then... I guess I'll look around.
Wonderful. What kind of item are you looking for?
A tea set.
A traditional Japanese tea set.
A pet food bowl.
I'm looking for a tea set.

Well then, I know the perfect one. Please have a
look at this.

Whoa... This is a fine piece... but this is a golf
tee.
It's a 12-piece set.

No. My little sister doesn't play golf. I think.
That's not it, I'm looking for the kind of tea set
that an antique shop carries.

Oh, my apologies. I have mistaken the type of
tee" you were looking for."
Well yeah, but this is an antique shop, isn't it?
Well then, please have a look to your right.

Right side...? Oh... I see something,
but what is it?
It's a huge letter T"... And there's a chain, a

Operator: whip, and a candle... And what's this?"

Key:
Huh? A toothpick, a cross, teriyaki jerky...
What?! A table runner, and even a toy duck...
It's a T-set.

Uh, what can you use this set for?!
It makes no sense!
My apologies.

Um... Like I told you, I'm looking for a tea set.
You know, what you would use to pour tea and drink
with...
Oh, that's what you meant.

Usually people don't mistake it for anything
else... And what is the T-set anyways?
I've never heard of it...
It's Tohka's special set.

Didn't see that one coming! What reason would you
have to put them all together for?!

If it's something you pour tea with,
it will be here.

So you're going to ignore my question?! Well, it's
fine, I guess...
So this here is foreign porcelain...
Wow! Wait, is this Meissen china?
Mei...? Uh... what did you just say...?
Meissen. That famous kind of porcelain?
Y-Yeah... I think it's that Meissen...

You think... Why do you not sound very confident
about it...? Uh, this is an antique, isn't it?

Yes, of course it is. Isn't it that famous Meissen
porcelain?

Why are you answering with a question?! I'm asking
you.
Sir, please do not worry. This is an an-tick shop.
You mean... antique, right?

Since this is an an-tick shop, every item is
priced at museum-worthy levels.

You said it again, but you still didn't
say it right!
My apologies.

(This is weird. At first, the shop had this air of
elegance and fantasy. Now it feels like a very
ordinary place.)
So about the pork cutlet sandwich you wanted...

I didn't ask for that! How does a tea set become a
pork cutlet sandwich...
*Nom, nom*...
She's eating one...!
Yeah! I was getting a bit hungry...
Ngh... She's a total glutton...

Ahem. Anyways. You were looking for a tea set,
were you not?
Yes... I am. I'm sorry, but I've changed my mind.
But why?

I mean, that tea set still has the pricing sticker
from the discount store.
How strange...

Not strange. Not strange... This shop is basically
a discount store. If I bought this, God knows what
Kotori would say to me...
G-Grrrr...

That said... I'm sorry, but I won't be buying
anything for today.
W-Wait, customer!

Th-The way you're talking...! What happened to the
elegant way you spoke earlier?!

Why, you... You think this store is no big deal,
so you're making fun of it, aren't you?

N-No... Well, I don't know much about this
place... but I can't help but feel that the
owner is...

In that case, allow me to show you the finest tea
set we offer.

What?! Y-You have such a thing? Your tone changed
back to elegant...
*Giggle* Don't be surprised when you see it, okay?

(Uh, what do I do... I have no plans on buying a
real antique...)

(Well if we've come this far, I guess I am curious
as to whether this is a true antique shop...)

I believe it's under this shelf... Just a
moment... *grunt*...
Hey, that's dangerous...
Ah?! O-Oh, no!
AHHHHHH!

(While the owner hung her head low, I rushed out
of the shop. I'm never coming here again.)

I'm thinking tea time with a traditional Japanese
tea set would be cool.
A traditional Japanese tea set, huh...
Yes. D-Do you not have one...?

No, I happen to have some here in the back. Please
have a look.

Whoa, you do?! I see... The back corner seems to
have a very Japanese style to it.
Please feel free to look around.
D-Don't mind if I do...
(There are a lot of things here. Let's see...)

W-Wow, this is one nice tea set. What's the tray
made of?
That is... wood.

Huh? Yes, I understand it's wood. I meant to ask
what kind of wood.
J-Japanese wood, I would say.
Well... I'd assume it's from a Japanese tree!

(Huh... Just earlier, this place felt so
fantastical and elegant, but suddenly
I'm getting this vibe of uselessness...)

I want to know the specifics, like whether it's
Japanese cedar, Paulownia, or Hinoki cypress...
Wouldn't you know as the shop owner?
It's a Japanese tree.
No, that doesn't really change anything.
I'm sorry. It is a very old item...
Y-Yeah... I do see that it's old. O-Oh well.
My apologies.

So, do you know what the teapot is made of? It
kind of looks like a fusion between the east
and the west.
Yes. It's made of metal.

Well, I know that part. I mean, is it pure silver,
or just silver-plated...
Of course, it is made with metals from this earth.

I-I knew that... I figured it was made on this
earth as well.
It's Earth metal.
You don't have to specify that.
It is the herald of Gaia.

That sounds a bit cooler, but that's not what we
need here. You understand, right?
My apologies.

Something feels suspicious... I'm starting to feel
like this shop is only for show. Well, anyways...
What about this teacup?

Oh that is in the Arita style.
It uses eco-porcelain.
Oh?

The dye is made with a traditional style called
Mr. Nabeshima-style, a certain firing technique...
The color produced is vibrant, yet calming.
Now you're too knowledgeable!
My apologies.

...You were reading out of a catalogue! You had me
for a second!
Don't mind me.
Of course I do!

So what do you say, sir? Was there anything you
liked?
Hmm... At this rate, I don't think I can decide...
Take your time...

I can't do that. I need to go home
and make dinner.
...Dinner?!
Huh?
...Nothing.
Were you reacting to the dinner part?
Of course that is not the case.
...I'm making Hamburg steak tonight.
What?! Hamburg steak?!
So you were reacting to dinner.
Th-That is not the case.
This is really trippy.

(Hm... I wonder why, but the more I talk to her,
the more her image from before crumbles...)

(I don't want her to make me buy anything weird. I
shouldn't rush to make a purchase...)
Anyways... I'll have to go for today.

What? I-I see... I mean, er, is that so? Please do
not say such things, and take another look
around...

No, no, I'm done for the day.
Sorry to take your time.
Oh?! P-Please wait! Sir... I mean, Hamburg!

Who are you calling Hamburg?! Hey... something
looks like it's about to fall.
Huh? AHHHHH!

(In the end, I didn't buy anything, but I guess it
couldn't be helped. I'll tell Kotori I couldn't
find anything good enough.)

(That store seemed to be a hazard. I mean,
for a split second, it was really elegant, but...
I guess I can visit another time... or maybe not.)
I'll go home now...
You see, I'm looking for a pet food bowl.

A pet bowl? I thought you were searching for
something for your little sister.
Well I was, but I thought it'd be funny.

Then what do you think about this item? It's a
vintage stainless steel feeder.
Oh, that's pretty cool. I'll take it.
Thank you for your purchase.
I wonder how Kotori will react.
So... What is the meaning of this, Shido?
W-Well...

Jeez, you can't even do the one thing I ask you to
do...

No, you see, it's....! Let me explain. I wanted
you to enjoy it, so I thought and thought...

And you thought about buying me a doggy bowl?
Are you trying to start a fight with me? How very
bold...
*Whimper*...

I suppose for tonight, this can be
your dinner plate.
O-Okay...

*Whimper*... I shouldn't buy anything on impulse
again.
